description: Variation of condition No. 2 (Plans) of planning permission ref: P1866.18 dated 19/02/2019 to regularise alterations to the fenestration of the Annex building 48 Main Road. (The Proposal is for the addition of lift access and addition of roof accommodation to the annex along with extension to the rear of the annex (2-3 storeys). The Proposal is also for extensions on the first floor to the Main hotel building.)
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).

The Local Planning Authority consider it essential that the whole of the development is carried out and that no departure whatsoever is made from the details approved, since the development would not necessarily be acceptable if partly carried out or carried out differently in any degree from the details submitted.  Also, in order that the development accords with Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61.
All new external finishes shall be carried out in materials to match those of the existing building(s) to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.

To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area, and in order that the development accords with the Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61.

No window or other opening (other than those shown on the submitted and approved plan) shall be formed in the flank walls of the building unless specific permission under the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 has first been sought and obtained in writing from the Local Planning Authority.
In order to ensure a satisfactory development that will not result in any loss of privacy or damage to the environment of neighbouring properties which exist or may be proposed in the future.

Within three months of the date of this approval, a scheme detailing planting to the boundary with Hill Court in particular the area where the car park borders this site shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. All planting, seeding or turfing comprised within the scheme shall be carried out in the first planting season following approval of those details and any trees or plants which within a period of 5 years from completion of the development die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased shall be replaced in the next planting season with others of a similar size and species, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.
To ensure that the development achieves a satisfactory level of landscape quality throughout.

The doors located in the ground floor south facing elevation of the annexe extension which replace windows permitted in the original scheme shall be used only in emergencies and shall not at any time be used in lieu of other access to the rooms they serve.
Reason:- In the interests of preventing nuisance to surrounding occupiers.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, improvements required to make the proposal acceptable were negotiated with the agent in writing. A roof plan and revised floor plan to reflect elevation drawings was requested. The amendments were subsequently submitted on 10-11-2022
